name: Stack Project
description:
Remenber that old game named Stack Attack, playable on these old solid rocks of a mobile phone by Siemens?

Stack Project is my recreation of that ancient entertainment classic.

Developing this:

It's my first game that i was proud enough to finish a playable version to publish. The game is the product of my learning process with Unity, so it's far away from being optimized besides Unity's automated stuff they do. But I would say while playing you probably don't notice that.

The Game:

As mentioned above this game is a recreation. As such I tried to keep look and feel as close to the original as possible. I oriented myself at the game version from the Siemens ME45, C45 or A50. Therefor I keeped the orange/brown-ish LCD optic. For the graphics and animations I used some youtube videos of the original game and some of the game features I built in from my own memory playing the game as a kid.

The Story:

While developing I had so much fun, that I added a pinch of secret story to the game.
It's hidden, but not too hard to find... I hope so. :D

How to Play?

Some cranes are dropping boxes from above. Avoid being crushed underneath. You can push a box sideways. If the bottom row is full, the row explodes and a new crane is added, making the game harder and harder. There's no highscore system right now, like in the original.

Controls:
  • Keyboard:
    Walk - A/D
    Jump - W or Space
    Diagonal - Q/E
    Reset - Esc
    Quit - Esc (Doubletap)
  • Keyboard (alternate):
    Walk - Num 4/6
    Jump - Num 8
    Diagonal - Num 7/9
  • (Xbox) Gamepad:
    Walk - Left Stick
    Jump - A
    Diagonal - Shoulder Buttons or X and B
    Reset - Start
    Quit - Start (Doubletap)
